attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Allow UK students to use student loans within the EU - OR lower tuition fees
attributes.background: The conservative government in power should allow UK students to use their student loans to study at universities within the EU after Brexit OR lower our tuition fee's to minimize out debt for an education we surely need if the country is going to function without EU professional workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The freedom of information responses compiled by the Liberal Democrats from 80 of the 136 NHS acute trusts in England shows that 2,700 EU nurses left the health service in 2016, compared to 1,600 EU nurses in 2014 – a 68% increase.

If leaving the EU means letting go of many of our much-needed professionals, the UK university tuition fees need to either be lowered or student loans need to allow our youth to study where it's cheaper.

The average student debt at graduation is £50,800 - source IFS.

Do we really expect our youngest and brightest to thrive with that much debt on their shoulders?

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: Knife crime attacks to be reclassified as attempted murder.
attributes.background: In an effort to reduce the number of knife attacks and stabbings, reclassify stabbing another person as a minimum criminal charge of attempted murder upon that other person.

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Introcude machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid
attributes.background: Encourage the government to install recyclable machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid in vouchers, this would encourage customers to recycle and get paid for that’s, that’s a win for win.
attributes.additional_details: In my recent trip to Germany I went to a supermarket and realised that they have machines installed across every single supermarket that’s encourages customers to recycle pet bottles and cans, furthermore they get vouchers from the supermarket that reduces their daily shopping costs by just recycling their cans and bottles. living in the uk, this is a must it’s win-win for both sides, customers bring the materials and get paid, the government reduced the plastic cost and reuses the old plastic.

attributes.action: To have the DCPC stopped
attributes.background:
HGV drivers have held there licences for years and then to be told to do a DCPC course is a disgace to the industry. You can take the same modules 5 times over, how can this help?

We will lose good professional drivers due to the costs.
attributes.additional_details: hgv driver for 20 years, transport manager for 20 years,

attributes.action: I think school should be held Monday to Wednesday, giving us a longer weekend
attributes.background: I believe that having school five days a week makes kids feel more negatively towards having to drag themselves there everyday. I think that if we reduce this to three days per week then kids will have a more positive attitude towards school and take more information in. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: My evidence is that I am a pupil that doesn’t particularly enjoy school and the amount of work to complete each week. If school time is reduced by a couple days per week then I would learn more. However, if this petition was approved holiday times would also need to be reduced, but not enough that we’re still at school the same amount of time.

attributes.action: Kids can drive at the age of 16
attributes.background:
If this goes into place then kids won't need a excuse for being late to school /college and will be able to travel to school then take transport which
1.won't be as packed which will cause less arguments/ fights
2.will also give kids experience for jobs in the future.

attributes.action: Provide funding for school children to access leisure centres or gyms
attributes.background: Leisure centre memberships are expensive and many families cannot afford them. This is why I think pupils from primary to end of secondary schools should be provided with them. First to motivate more children to get into sports and to get fitter and to resolve Britain’s immense problem with obesity.
attributes.additional_details:
Did you know that in England the prevalence of overweight and obesity is above 70% among all age groups from 45 upwards.
 
For more information go visit https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN03336/SN03336.pdf

attributes.action: Change the 9-1 grading system back to the ABCD system.
attributes.background: With the changing of the grading systems it has caused a lot of confusion in the education department. We, as students, often ask our teachers to explain the system. Some teachers can’t explain because they have no idea why the grading system changed in the first place and they don’t understand it.
attributes.additional_details: When parents ask about student’s grades they’re always confused and ask for the ABCD equivalent anyway. Why do we have to translate our own grades? If we say we’ve got a grade 7, for example, the response is always “Is that good?” There has been far too much pressure and stress put on students and teachers over these past couple of years and the changing of the grading system is useless! What’s the point in having 9-1 when we are always going to ask what the ABCD equivalent is anyway?

attributes.action: Increase the Minimum wage for Under 18's, because it is too low to cover costs
attributes.background: The current UK minimum wage is £4.20. It violates rights for under 18's. And its harder for young adults to be able to save and invest. It creates boundaries. There are many costs which they cannot cover. Prices for food, drinks and clothes have gone up. So why cant the price of hourly wage go up.
attributes.additional_details: Currently most UK teenagers are being forced to work for £4.20 an hour. Some of those cannot provide enough to support their families. The cost for living has gone up. Its more expensive to live in this day and era. The price of a cup of coffee is £3.50. The price of daily necessities has increased rapidly. More and more families are becoming vulnerable, and parents of those young workers may not be able to provide for them. So they get a job. But £4.20 an hour is the price of peanuts.

attributes.action: Tell schools to take sickness into account for attendance awards
attributes.background: Children with constant hospital appointments never get attendance awards. It’s not fair if others have fun and they don’t just because they have a medical condition.
attributes.additional_details: I think we should still have rewards but it would not count on their attendance if they have any kind of an appointment (with proof) or is sick. The Government’s guidance should say this.

attributes.action: Introduce a subject covering covering current events to the secondary curriculum
attributes.background: After completing my GCSEs last summer, I noticed that there were a lack of subjects explaining current events that will effect my future, and I believe, as a school's purpose is to educate their students, and prepare them for their future, a class covering current events would help prepare them.
attributes.additional_details: Adding a 'current events' subject to the secondary curriculum across the UK would help greatly in making the students more aware of the world that they're about to go into.

attributes.action: Make Albanian a GCSE or A Level
attributes.background: There are thousands and thousands of young Albanians and Kosovans across our country, and we have to value this, make 'Shqip' a language you can pick for your GCSE's. England is supposed to be a very multicultural country and we have to value it.

attributes.action: Stronger sentences for abandoning dogs and cats in public places
attributes.background: There are far too many Dogs and Cats just Dumped on the Roads and other Public Spaces, it does NOT make sense when there are Rescue places who will take them, the ones who do this do NOT have any concern to what happens to them, seeing Dogs are man’s best friend it is Cruel and lacking Respect.
attributes.additional_details: There has been many such cases like the car that was caught on CCTV throwing its bed out and the dog trying to say, You have Forgotten Me, dumped in sealed boxes, one dog tied to a post outside a Rescue place when they just could have taken it in, Animals are NOT a throwaway item and need more Protection.

attributes.action: Make it a legal UK requirement that councils provide public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK, public toilets are closing. These actions are unfair on all sections of our society. It is a natural requirement to use toilets. It is illegal to defecate or urinate in the street so it should be a legal requirement to provide the facilities required to avoide breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
When the body needs to meet such needs, no amount of will power will over ride this no mater what the legal penalty is so what civilised country should put its citizens in such a position.

Councils should legally provide such services in all urban areas but should also not issue licences to any businesses selling refreshments if there are not toilet facilities available to its customers within say 100 meters of the business.

attributes.action: Stop government from putting pensioners who claim pension credit on UC
attributes.background: In May this year, Amber Rudd is to bring in that a couple where the older person claims pension credit and has a partner younger will lose a lot of money, because the government will be putting them on universal credit, which means you could lose about £400 to £900 a month.

attributes.action: Stop people buying animals for Christmas then getting rid of them,
attributes.background: Anyone getting an animal should be made to have a licence, as well as the animal being chipped, 1,000 pound fine for anyone who decides to just dump there animal, or imprisonment. Also a 5,000 pound license for animal breaders and only 2 litters aloud. All puppy kittens to be chipped.

attributes.action: Regulate fitness professional qualifications and ban fast track courses.
attributes.background: The fitness industry is suffering from underqualifed and inexperienced people masquerading as “professionals” due to fast track courses. We ask For a set standard for the qualification of both “fitness instructor” and “personal trainer” positions to avoid public injury and dangerous misinformation.

attributes.action: Lower the age of being able to change your name by deed poll to 13
attributes.background: A teenager should be able to change their name if they want to and not have to wait until they are 16.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a lot of teens that wanted to change their names before they hit 13 but they couldn't because they don't always have permission off both parents even if one parent has been absent for most of their lives or has caused destruction in their lives.
They should have the right to decide.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to have a licence to breed pets
attributes.background: A licence to breed pets will enable Britain to be the real nation of animal lovers it so claims to be! Licensing would show that a person is breeding a pet for the right reasons, not just for money, breeding an animal for good reasons like bringing out the heredity problems in breeds.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Battersea dogs home took in 3,373 dogs but only 2,249 rehomed! That leaves over 1,000 dogs without a place to call home. Stop pets being left behind in kennels, catteries and animal shelters. I hope by making people have a licence to breed pets it will reduce the numbers that the animal shelters are crowded by. 
I also hope it will stop animals from being left at the side of the road. 
This in turn will make more people buy a rescue animal instead of a home bread animal.

attributes.action: Allow Polish people freedom of movement after the Brexit.
attributes.background: We owe the Polish for fighting the Germans in WW2 in the air and on the ground. This is fact.
attributes.additional_details: The Polish are very patriotic people and should be allowed with open arms into the UK.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum jail term for flying a drone over a UK airport to 10 years.
attributes.background:
The signatories to this petition want to see the maximum sentence for flying an unmanned drone over a UK airport increased from 5 to 10 years.

We also want clear direction given to the courts that severe sentences - close to or at the maximum - should be handed down for such reckless behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen (December 2018) the scant disregard for the safety of aircraft, passengers and staff by those intentionally flying an unmanned drone over protected airspace at London Gatwick Airport.

Given the risk to human life from such reckless actions, and the significant cost and disruption, signatories to this period want to see the minimum sentence raised to ten years and used for mindless idiots endangering life.

attributes.action: All car parks should have at least 10% electric car charging stations (free).
attributes.background: All car parks with more than 10 bays should have mandatory car charging stations available. All office building and warehouses with permanent employee presence where the car is parked for more than 8 hours should have free car charging facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
People go in super markets and normally spend 20 to 60 minutes, car manufacturers say that the car be charged from 20% to 80% in 40 minutes, these 40 minutes should be utilised and people will have the cars charged up when they are done shopping, and this charging should be free.
The 10% minimum requirement mentioned above should be raised by 5% each year.
At permanent place of work this energy for car charging should mainly come from Solar panels.

attributes.action: Ban sugar in Leisure Centres, Hospitals & all other places that promote health.
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to tackle obesity so, in places that are meant to be promoting health, a total ban on sugared products would quite simply just make sense. Being able to buy a chocolate bar and fully sugared drink in a gym is a total contradiction of its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Sugar is the number 1 cause of children being admitted to hospital in the U.K. for oral problems. Type 2 diabetes has never been so abundant. High street stores are having to change their sizing criteria. Education is the most powerful tool in which you can change the world but when no one is properly educating and no one is properly listening, removing choice is the only way to get proper results.

attributes.action: Dissolve
attributes.background:
Dissolution is the official term for the end of a Parliament. 25 days after a successful motion to dissolve a general election must be held.
Members of parliament in all parties fear the result of a general election too much to table the motion so we, the people, must demand it to see it happen.
attributes.additional_details:
"On a motion to dissolve the Parliament then in existence dissolves at the beginning of the 25th working day before the polling day for the next parliamentary general election as determined under section 1 or appointed under section 2(7)" Fixed-term Parliament Act of 2011.
The Government does not resign when Parliament is dissolved. Government ministers remain in charge of their departments but may not after the result of the election is known and a new administration is formed.

attributes.action: Make a governmental apology for the massacre at Jalianwala Bagh (Amritsar 1919)
attributes.background: April 2019 will mark 100 Years since the bloody Vaisakhi of 1919 when a massacre was carried against the people of Punjab in which several hundreds at least lost their lives. We must never forget the tyranny of the 'Butcher of Amritsar' General Reginald Dyer.

attributes.action: Amend BBC Charter to cap executive salaries at no more than the Prime Minister's
attributes.background: This is a public body and employees should not earn more than the Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
The general public are fed up with huge salaries , mainly being earned by those in the south of the country. 
As the BBC is funded by the public, salaries for executives should be capped.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for the recruitment industry
attributes.background: A regulatory body should be introduced to ensure recruiters play fair with all parties.

attributes.action: Allow more funding for Ex-Military and Ex-Service personnel suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: It is far too common for our Ex- Service and Ex-Military personnel to be suffering with PTSD. People who suffer from PTSD often suffer from nightmares, flashbacks, difficulty sleeping, and feeling emotionally numb. These symptoms can significantly impair a person's daily life.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should the people who fought so hard for our lives be the ones left to suffer?

PTSD is marked by clear physical and psychological symptoms. It often has symptoms like depression, substance abuse, problems of memory and cognition, and other physical and mental health problems. The disorder is also associated with difficulties in social or family life, including occupational instability, marital problems, family discord, and difficulties in parenting.

REF- https://www.military.com/benefits/veterans-health-care/posttraumatic-stress-disorder-overview.html

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Review racially discriminatory Gang Matrix(ces) obedience to human rights laws.
attributes.background: The Gang Matrix launched by Trident Gang Command is a system that has been found to disproportionately target BAME young men in their relation, or lack thereof, to gang crime. Information is often shared with other authorities limiting their access to opportunities and their chances of success.
attributes.additional_details:
The Metropolitan Police Service Gangs Violence Matrix and other similar Matrices should be dismantled, unless police services can demonstrate that they have been brought in line with international human rights law, in particular, the right to non-discrimination, privacy and family life, as contained in international human rights law. 
For further details read the recommendations highlighted in Amnesty International report: https://www.amnesty.org.uk/files/reports/Trapped%20in%20the%20Matrix%20Amnesty%20report.pdf

attributes.action: Improve the recruiting drive for the British armed forces.
attributes.background: I don’t feel enough is being done, as a current applicant myself I can see simply not enough is being done. We need to bring back recruiting ads to TV, make the application process more appealing to a civilian and improve the quality of ad, in particular the army (look at the Royal Marines adverts).

attributes.action: Ban (military grade armour piercing) 0.50 or higher calibre rifles in the UK
attributes.background:
Despite the overwhelming support for strict gun control in the United Kingdom the Government is failing to ban certain military-grade guns in its new Offensive Weapons Bill.

This is unacceptable and places the British public at direct risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/offensiveweapons.html

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-politics-46377250

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/government-ban-50-caliber-offensive-weapons-bill-sajid-javid-violence-a8657046.html

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915

attributes.action: Reinstate the Senior care worker on the job shortage list (Tier 2 visa General)
attributes.background: All care sectors across the UK, have benefited from staffing through Senior care workers being on job shortage list (Tier 2 General). Since the removal of this profession from the list it has been increasingly difficult for employers to find staff to work  senior care job roles.
attributes.additional_details: Care settings such as NHS, private residential homecare, nursing homes and domiciliary care have all benefited for this profession being on the job shortage list.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.
